LineItemTitle.val: Sub Periscope, Imaging and Supt Equip Prog

Description.val:
The Submarine Periscope, Imaging, and Support Equipment program provides critical electromagnetic systems to all classes of submarine platforms.  Systems include Imaging, Electronic Warfare (EW), and RADAR systems which provide navigation safety and collision avoidance, particularly in high intensity littoral operations so that surveillance and weapons systems can be effectively employed.  

FY20 shifts EW to the Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System (SWFTS) model consistent with other SWFTS subsystems (SSN Acoustic Equipment, SSN Combat Control Systems, and Imaging Systems).  As a result, ML012 is a new cost code that provides greater visibility into planned procurement costs in alignment with SWFTS and differentiates the cost of the digital upgrades planned for TI-20 and beyond.  Additionally, ML009 is established to procure the Electronic Warfare Tactical TEMPALT (EWTT) which fills the gap in Communications Acquisition and Direction Finding (CADF) capability in VA BLK IV in order to meet the EW Capability Development Document (CDD) requirements.  A gap was created when the CADF production line closed at the end of VA BLK III production and the subsequent cancellation of TI-16/18 NGA contracts, which would have replaced ICADF.

The Submarine Periscopes and Imaging Equipment Program procures the Type 18 and Type 8 periscope upgrades; the Photonics Mast and its variants, including the Low Profile Photonics Mast (LPPM), Type 20 (previously named TOTIM), and Type 24 Mast; the Integrated Submarine Imaging System (ISIS); imaging upgrades for all submarine classes; and Photonics and LPPM land-based spares.  By OPNAV Ltr Ser. N77/3U629209, 12 June 2003, OPNAV N87 established the ISIS to rapidly field these systems and integrate existing periscope imagery systems into a single system for installation on board submarines.  An ISIS Capability Development Document (CDD) was approved 22 Dec 2011, with an update to the CDD approved on 15 Mar 2018.  The CDD is used to fully integrate the ISIS program of record into the submarine force's rapid technology insertion process and to incorporate Fleet-endorsed requirements such as LPPM.  ISIS supports high intensity operations in the littorals, providing the submarine force with the tactical imaging systems necessary to safely and effectively employ its surveillance and weapons capabilities.  The IR imaging capability improves imaging at night and in low visibility conditions.  Technology Insertion initiatives include the common control and displays hardware and software on all platforms regardless of imaging sensors, an integrated imaging system that provides for operator alerts, imaging enhancement tools and contact analysis tools, incorporation of LPPM, Type 20 Mast, Type 24 Mast, future sensors, and a fully SWFTS integrated system.  Funding improves submarine imaging capability in the areas of: ship safety, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR), tactical control (contact management in the littorals) to provide high quality imaging 24 hours a day, 7 days a week in all weather conditions to support submarine operations worldwide.

PL010 - Imaging ISIS Technical Insertion
Continues procurement of Technical Insertion kits, Design Services Allocation (DSA) installation support, and spares to upgrade ISIS systems on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, VIRGINIA and OHIO Class SSGN/SSBN platforms to allow for Capability Insertion and obsolescence avoidance.  Starting with TI-16, funding includes the one time change for improved copper-fiber optic diploops and hull penetrators (Mast Compatibility) required to support advanced Imaging and Early Warning capabilities included in LPPM, Type 20, and Type 24 Masts.

PL011 - Imaging Upgrades: Type 8/Type 18
Continues procurement of Periscopes and Imaging Equipment reliability, capability, and maintainability upgrades, e.g., Eyepiece Box, periscope mechanical hoisting mechanism upgrades, inboard electronic processing hardware and associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS), Robust Surveillance Program, Certification of regional repair centers for Imaging System maintenance and technical data. Variable quantities and types are bought in each fiscal year based on Fleet-endorsed requirements.

PL012 - Periscope Special Support Equipment
Procures replacements in support of Special Support Equipment (SSE) for each maintenance level to ensure imaging systems are maintained in a state of operational readiness.  Equipment includes Q-Band Test Equipment, Mast Dynamic Collimator, Eyebox/Mast Test Set, and Antenna/Outer Head Simulator required due to obsolescence of existing imaging systems SSE.

PL015 - Periscope Interim Contractor Support
Funding is for Interim Contract Support provided by the periscope manufacturer.  The majority of the funding is for Type 18 service life extension, depot repair and upgrades for all configurations of Photonics Masts including LPPM and Type 20 masts.  It also funds all levels of repairs for all types of tactical submarine imaging systems.

PL016 - Periscope Training
Funding is for imaging systems training requirements to include curriculum development, training materials, and initial factory training pilot course conduct, Navy Training Plans, and instructor advisory services.

PL025 - Low Profile Mast
Funding is for the procurement, support and technical insertion of VIRGINIA Class low profile imaging masts (including LPPM, Type 20 Mast (previously named TOTIM), and Type 24) production modules and land based spare masts and associated components.  The spares will be used for replacement Imaging Masts on VIRGINIA Class submarines.  Quantity of spares will increase with VIRGINIA submarine procurements.

PL830 - Periscope Production Engineering
Production Engineering funds provide the following functions: value engineering; review and evaluation of production design data and documentation; production configuration control; maintenance engineering efforts designed and incorporated into the production manufacturing process, and other related engineering functions that are integral to all of the Imaging Systems and ancillary components.

PL927 - Fleet Modernization Program Installs
Funding is for the installation of Fleet Modernization Program Equipment.

PL4M7 - Non-Fleet Modernization Program Installs
Funding is for the installation of non-Fleet Modernization Program Equipment.

The Submarine Support Equipment Program (SSEP) procures submarine Electronic Warfare (EW) systems: AN/BLQ-10, Submarine Launched Device (SLD), Multifunction Modular Masts (MMM), MMM Payloads, Communications Acquisition and Direction-Finding (CADF) systems, Electronic Warfare Tactical TEMPALT (EWTT), Field Change Kits, PATRIOT and BPS 15/16/17 RADARs.  The SSEP also supports all ILS, production engineering, Cyber, sustainment, and installation requirements for EW systems.  The Submarine EW Capability Development Document (CDD) 907-97-16 was approved on 27 September 2016 and provides all requirements for Submarine EW systems.  FY20 introduces two new cost codes to SSEP funding.  ML009 has been created to support funding required to procure and maintain the Fleet directed EWTT.  ML012 provides funding for the AN/BLQ-10B, which is the advanced submarine system that achieves EW superiority through hardware and software updates to pace the threat and brings EW fully onto the SWFTS model.  The Technical Insertion/Advanced Processing Build (TI/APB) SWFTS model modernizes and sustains approximately 8-12 SSNs/SSGNs per year through executing bi-annual software APBs and bi-annual hardware TIs.  SWFTS related annual funding varies based on the number of modernizations funded.  Both the EWTT and the AN/BLQ-10B are required to meet the Submarine EW CDD and are new systems not previously procured under existing cost codes.  Procurement of the initial AN/BLQ-10 systems as replacement for WLR-8 on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, VIRGINIA and SSGN Class submarines is complete and as a result ML015 is discontinued.  Procurement of the EWTT fills the gap in CADF capability in VA BLK IV to meet the EW CDD requirements.  A gap was created when the CADF production line closed at the end of VA BLK III production and the subsequent cancellation of TI-16/18 NGA contracts, which would have replaced ICADF.

ML003 - SSEP Special Support Equipment
SSEP special support equipment allows the procurement of special purpose test equipment utilized by the Type Commander Groom Teams.  Exact quantities vary from year to year based on Fleet requirements.

ML007 - CADF
Procures the Communications Acquisition and Direction Finding (CADF) systems for installation on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF and VIRGINIA Class submarines. A gap was created when the CADF production line closed at the end of VA BLK III production and the subsequent cancellation of TI-16/18 NGA contracts which would have replaced ICADF.

ML008 - MMM
Procures the Multi-Function Modular Mast (MMM) Antenna and subsystems for installation on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, and VIRGINIA Class submarines.  The MMM provides the sensor to conduct direction finding in the communications radio frequency bands as well as a volume for payload integration.

ML009 - EWTT
Procures and refurbishes the Electronic Warfare Tactical TEMPALT (EWTT) filling the gap in CADF capability on VA Class BLK IV submarines necessary to meet EW CDD requirements.  A gap was created when the CADF production line closed at the end of VA BLK III production and the subsequent cancellation of TI-16/18 NGA contracts, which would have replaced ICADF.

ML010 - EW Technical Insertion
Procures Technical Insertions (TI) up through and including TI-18 for installation on LOS ANGELES, SSGN, SEAWOLF, and VIRGINIA Class submarines that provide updates to the AN/BLQ-10A configuration baseline.  The final TI-18 installations will end in FY21.  Beginning with TI-20, all AN/BLQ-10 costs are captured in ML012 due to the significant changes associated with the AN/BLQ-10B upgrade.

ML012 (P-40a) - SWFTS Supportability and Integration
Tech Refresh provides for software and hardware updates to accommodate shifts in technology to the execution procurement years "current state-of-the-practice" hardware.  Updates are necessary for signal and display processing hardware as software is introduced or as commercial support for the hardware is phased out.  When EW systems are being upgraded to subsequent phases, signal processing and display hardware will be upgraded to accommodate common technology consistent with the APB being implemented in the year of introduction.  In future years, requirements include additional equipment to prevent COTS hardware from becoming unsupportable/obsolete.  Funding will be used to support non-recurring first article test efforts associated with changing COTS environment, as well as, procuring test equipment and simulators.  Supports Government Furnished Information (GFI) management and coordination, monitoring of contractor cost, performance and schedule, cost analysis and estimation, contract specification development and monitoring of contract deliverables.  Addresses the Cyber requirements associated with procuring, engineering and sustaining EW systems.  Also supports EW system training requirements to include curriculum development, training materials, and initial factory training pilot course conduct, Navy Training Plans, instructor advisory services, and hardware/software upgrades for EW trainers.

ML012 (P-3a) - AN/BLQ-10B Technical Insertion
Procures the AN/BLQ-10B EW system for installation on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, and VIRGINIA Class submarines beginning with TI-20.  AN/BLQ-10B achieves EW superiority through hardware and software updates to pace the threat and brings EW fully onto the SWFTS model.  Tech insertion procures the hardware necessary to upgrade and back-fit EW systems.  This system will be fully aligned with SWFTS with the exception of SSBN Class and provides capabilities required by the EW Capability Development Document (CDD). 

ML014 - Legacy Submarine Surveillance Measures
Continues legacy Submarine Electronic Surveillance Measures (SubESM) procurement including AN/BRD-7 and AN/WLR-8 Reliability and Maintainability (R&M) obsolescence and operational Field Change Kits and other materials for Obsolescence Mitigation, e.g., Digital Display Unit (DDU) obsolescence upgrade, Solid State Memory, Heat Dissipation improvement, related H,M&E sail components, Analog relay replacement, antenna cabling replacement, related Hull, Mechanical & Electrical (H,M&E) sail components and associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS), and technical data.

ML017 - AN/BLQ-10 Field Change Kits
Procures AN/BLQ-10 subsystem Product Improvement Field Change Kits including: emergent Engineering Changes, SWFTS associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) and technical data. Provides AN/BLQ-10 intermediate level repairs, changes and maintenance activities and associated materials that improve the overall Reliability, Maintainability and Availability of fielded EW systems. Procures sustainment efforts for AN/BLQ-10 active, deploying fleet assets. Provides funding for Submarine Launched Device Buoy to reduce risk of counter-detection for operating submarines. Provides funding for procurement of MMM Payload to support submarine Fleet required improved Unmanned Aerial System (UAS) communications and Electronic Attack (EA) capability.

ML018 - VIRGINIA Class EW Modernization
Funds procure EW Modernization upgrades to the VIRGINIA Class AN/BLQ-10 EW system including Photonics ES Product Improvement (PEPI-3), PATRIOT Phase B RADAR.

ML020 - AN/BLQ-10
Funds procure AN/BLQ-10 Non-Recurring Engineering (NRE) and modernization kits for EW Modernization upgrades on all SSN/SSGN platforms.  The AN/BLQ-10 efforts augment the current AN/BLQ-10 system for the rapid fielding of required capabilities to address changing and emerging threats in the Radio Frequency (RF) spectrum.  This serves as a building block to future AN/BLQ-10 upgrades.  In addition, each procurement aligns with hardware builds supporting platform level SWFTS.  Beginning with TI-20, all AN/BLQ-10 costs are captured in ML012 due to the significant changes associated with the AN/BLQ-10B upgrade.

ML021 - Submarine RADAR
Submarine RADAR funds provide AN/BPS-15/16/17 Reliability, Maintainability and Availability (RMA), Field Change Kits and material procurements for obsolescence mitigation.  Provides in-service and systems engineering, logistics, material, configuration management, quality assurance, installation and test certification support only for the Submarine Surface Navigation (AN/BPS-15/16/17) RADAR.  Provides for interface with the conjoined Voyage Management System (VMS) and Electronic Chart & Display Information System - Navy (ECDIS-N).  Funding addresses sustainability of PATRIOT Phase B RADAR including repair/refurbishment, in-service engineering, and modernization.

ML830 - EW Production Engineering
Production Engineering funds provide the following functions: value engineering; review and evaluation of production design data and documentation; production configuration control; maintenance engineering efforts designed and incorporated into the production manufacturing process, and other related engineering functions that are integral to all production EW Systems and upgrades.

ML927 - Fleet Modernization Program Installs
Provides for the Installation of Equipment including Fleet Modernization Program Installations for shipboard systems.

ML4M7 - Non-Fleet Modernization Program Installs
Provides for the Installation of non-Fleet Modernization Program Equipment.

Justification.val:
IMAGING - FY 2020 procures TI-16 on (1) VA Class and TI-18 on (5) Los Angeles Class, (2) SSGN Class, and (3) SSBN Class submarines. Budget installs SWFTS modernizations on (6) Los Angeles Class, (2) SSGN Class, and (2) SSBN Class submarines. FY 2020 also reflects a decrease of (2) Type 20 Masts to fund other higher priority Navy requirements.

FY 2019 procures TI-18 on (6) Los Angeles Class, (2) SSGN Class, and (2) SSBN Class submarines.  Budget installs SWFTS modernizations on (3) VIRGINIA Class, (6) Los Angeles Class, and (1) SEAWOLF Class submarines.  FY 2019 also procures (3) LPPM in order to meet PACFLT requirements for all deploying VIRGINIA Class submarines in the Pacific to be equipped with low profile imaging masts.


EW - FY 2020 shifts EW to the SWFTS model based on PMS401 and PMS425 with Industry as the Prime Integrator following the offramp of the Next Generation Architecture program.  This introduces ML012 as a new cost code to provide greater visibility into planned procurement costs in alignment with SWFTS and differentiates the cost of the digital upgrades planned for TI-20 and beyond.  The cost of TI-20 has been updated to reflect the difference between the previous plan of government led procurement and integration to industry as a prime design and integration agent.  Accordingly, NRE costs have been broken out from shipset costs in alignment with the other SWFTS subsystems (SSN Acoustic Equipment, SSN Combat Control Systems, and Imaging Systems) who use this model.  Additionally, ML009 is established to procure the Electronic Warfare Tactical TEMPALT (EWTT) which fills the gap in Communications Acquisition and Direction Finding (CADF) capability in VA BLK IV necessary to meet Capability Development Document (CDD) requirements.  A gap was created when the CADF production line closed at the end of VA BLK III production and the subsequent cancellation of TI-16/18 NGA contracts, which would have replaced ICADF.

FY 2019 procures TI-18 on (6) Los Angeles Class and (2) SSGN Class submarines.  FY 2019 installs SWFTS modernizations on (3) VIRGINIA Class, (6) Los Angeles Class, and (1) SEAWOLF Class submarines.  FY 2019 also procures (2) Multifunction Modular Mast (MMM) antenna improvement subsystems to increase reliability and reduce operational and maintenance costs for VIRGINIA modernizations and increases obligation to address obsolescence issues faced by the BPS RADAR system to ensure reliable safety of ship navigation and PATRIOT RADAR system to maintain tactical awareness in littoral operations.

Overall, there were no changes in FY19 from the PB19 position other than a $1.8M reduction due to Congressional action.  FY 2020 reflects a decrease of (2) TI-16 VA Class SWFTS shipsets compared to the PB19 position to fund other higher priority Navy requirements.

Name.@footnote: FY19 reduction due to Congressional Action.  FY20 and out restored to historical levels.

Beginning FY20, net zero transfer from existing procurement lines provide ML012 funding required to continue SWFTS supportability and integration for submarine EW systems.  This line is established to provide better fidelity of the support costs required to procure SWFTS EW Shipsets and separate the costs of quantified shipsets.

Tech Refresh provides for software and hardware updates to accommodate shifts in technology to the execution procurement years "current state-of-the-practice" hardware.  Updates are necessary for signal and display processing hardware as software is introduced or as commercial support for the hardware is phased out.  When EW systems are being upgraded to subsequent phases, signal processing and display hardware will be upgraded to accommodate common technology consistent with the APB being implemented in the year of introduction.  In future years, requirements include additional equipment to prevent COTS hardware from becoming unsupportable/obsolete.  Funding will be used to support non-recurring first article test efforts associated with changing COTS environment, as well as, procuring test equipment and simulators.  Supports Government Furnished Information (GFI) management and coordination, monitoring of contractor cost, performance and schedule, cost analysis and estimation, contract specification development and monitoring of contract deliverables.  Addresses the Cyber requirements associated with procuring, engineering and sustaining EW systems.  Also supports EW system training requirements to include curriculum development, training materials, and initial factory training pilot course conduct, Navy Training Plans, instructor advisory services, and hardware/software upgrades for EW trainers.

Cyber and Training Support funding supports the Cyber requirements associated with procuring, engineering and sustaining EW systems.  Also supports EW system training requirements to include curriculum development, training materials, and initial factory training pilot course conduct, Navy Training Plans, instructor advisory services, and hardware/software upgrades for EW trainers.

Name.val: 3) ML014 LEGACY SUBMARINE ELECTRONIC SURVEILLANCE MEASURES (SubESM)

Name.@footnote: TI/APB NRE funding levels are adjusted annually in response to the change in the complexity of each new capability being incorporated into the inboard imaging software.  FY20 NRE reduction is funded through corresponding increase in FY20 RDT&E PE 0604777N Project 0253 funding to support NRE activities.

Beginning in FY21, the unit cost for TI-20 includes additional hardware to integrate with the Type 20 Mast.  Mast Compatibility documented in 1.1.2 includes funding for the procurement of the Common Electrical Hull Penetrator and Common Dip Loop which is required for TI-16 and beyond installations. The Common Electrical Hull Penetrator and Common Dip Loop provides the required interface for current photonics masts, including the LPPM and supports all future mast types.  FY 2020 reflects a decrease of (2) TI-16 VA Class SWFTS shipsets compared to the PB19 position to fund other higher priority Navy requirements.    The two additional Virginia Class (VA) SWFTS shipsets procured in FY18 by congressional direction, will be installed in FY19 with funds obtained via below threshold reprogramming.
Name.val: 1.1.2) VA TECHNICAL INSERTION with MAST COMPATIBILITY (SWFTS) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: VA Technical Insertion without Mast Compatibility, documented in 1.1.3 procures hardware required for TI installations on platforms which have already received the Common Electrical Hull Penetrator and Common Dip Loop (see 1.1.2 footnote 4) during a prior modernization or during new construction.
Name.val: 1.1.3) VA TECHNICAL INSERTION without MAST COMPATIBILITY (SWFTS) - NonOrganic

Name.@footnote: Configuration Control Model (CCM) is a unique laboratory version of the ISIS kit that is used by support staff.  It allows technical experts to replicate issues identified in fielded systems, test resolutions to issues identified by fleet representatives, and conduct required testing for cyber security certification.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: VA TECHNICAL INSERTION with MAST COMPATIBILITY (SWFTS)
AIT:: Installation Name: VA TECHNICAL INSERTION without MAST COMPATIBILITY (SWFTS)
AIT:: Installation Name: SSGN TECHNICAL INSERTION (SWFTS)
AIT:: Installation Name: VA ISIS BACKFIT (SWFTS)

Description.val:
Provides for the modernization of Imaging systems and Technical Insertion kits to upgrade Integrated Submarine Imaging System (ISIS) on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, VIRGINIA and OHIO Class SSGN platforms in support of Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) requirements.  Unit costs for ISIS kits procurement and installation costs vary based on platform as certain platforms have a limited set of outboard masts which reduces the complexity of the ISIS kits while other boats utilize technically advanced masts which require more sophisticated ISIS hardware and software kits to support them.  VIRGINIA Tech Insertion unit costs reflect copper/fiber diploops and hull penetrators (Mast Compatibility) needed to field Low Profile Photonics Mast (LPPM), Type 20, and Type 24 Masts on these modernization hulls.  VIRGINIA Initial ISIS Backfits also contain copper/fiber updates for those hulls.  This line item aligns the periscope, imaging, and support equipment with the Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical System (SWFTS) interface with the Combat Control and Acoustic upgrades in budget line items 5420 and 2150.

Non-recurring engineering (NRE) is decreased due to transfer of NRE that has been funded in prior years under OPN BLI 0840 to RDTE Proj 0253.  The portion that is transferred is more appropriate for RDTE investment and reflects the maturity profile of the NRE effort.  This NRE funds the development of the Technical Insertion (TI) kit (software and hardware) baseline for each class of submarine.
Provides obsolescence related upgrades for Submarine Periscopes. One (1) set is procured in each fiscal year that includes variable quantities and types based on Fleet-endorsed requirements.

Name.@footnote: Installations are funded by TYCOMs as necessary to meet operational requirements and are mission specific.

The higher unit cost for Type 20 Mast compared to LPPM provides increased capability, reduced maintenance costs, and increased development flexibility for new mast sensors.  FY 2020 reflects a decrease of (2) TYPE 20 masts compared to the PB19 position to fund other higher priority Navy requirements.
Configuration Control Model (CCM) is a unique laboratory version of the Type 20 used by subject matter experts to support the integration of the Type 20 Mast with the ISIS hardware and software.

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: MAST CAPABILITY ENHANCEMENT

Description.val:
VA Class advanced low profile imaging masts including Low Profile Photonics Mast (LPPM), Type 20 Mast (previously named TOTIM), and Type 24 Masts.  Procures initial modernization assets as well as spare masts later in FYDP to maintain overall spares ratio for photonics masts as quantity of VA Class submarines increase.  Maintaining sufficient quantities of installed and spare low profile imaging masts is essential to meet PACFLT requirements for all deploying VA class submarines in the Pacific to be equipped with low profile imaging masts.  Similarly, there is a strong push from SUBLANT that all deploying units have a low profile mast which will significantly increase the number of required units.  With development commencing in FY18 and procurement beginning in FY20, the Type 20 Mast will provide increased capability, reduced maintenance costs, and increased development flexibility for new mast sensors.  

The higher unit cost for Type 20 Mast compared to LPPM provides increased capability, reduced maintenance costs, and increased development flexibility for new mast sensors.  FY 2020 reflects a decrease of (2) TYPE 20 masts compared to the PB19 position to fund other higher priority Navy requirements.

Provides advanced low-band Direction Finding (DF) capability compatible with the AN/BLQ-10 EW system.  The ICADF system is experiencing increasing failures and obsolescence issues shown in Operation Availability and Reliability, Maintainability, Availability analyses.  Beginning in FY24 with TI-24, the ICADF system will be replaced by a new CADF solution integrated with the AN/BLQ-10B system.  Note, ML009 delivers CADF capability to VA Class BLK IV in advance of Program of Record TI-24.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: Multi Functional Modular Mast

Description.val:
Synchronizes improved low-band direction finding sensor with coordinated N77/CNSG CLASSIC TROLL procurement.  Replaces obsolete AN/BRD-7 antenna equipment and Improved ESM Mast (IEM) with modern, open-architecture system compliant with Maritime Cryptologic Architecture.

The Multi-function Modular Mast (MMM) is the standard Communications Direction Finding mast on 688i and VA BLK III and following.  It improves the submarine's capability to conduct the CADF mission, as well as, provides a configurable volume for payloads that can enhance submarine capabilities in areas of Unmanned Aerial Systems, Electronic Attack, and Low Probability of Detection Communications.

FY22 procures the MMM for SEAWOLF Class submarines.

Procures and refurbishes the Electronic Warfare Tactical TEMPALT (EWTT) filling the gap in Communications Acquisition and Direction Finding (CADF) capability on VA Class BLK IV submarines necessary to meet EW Capability Development Document (CDD) requirements.  A gap was created when the CADF production line closed at the end of VA BLK III production and the subsequent cancellation of TI-16/18 NGA contracts, which would have replaced ICADF.  This system is required to meet the EW CDD 907-97-16 dtd 27 September 2016.  The EWTT is a Fleet directed system designed to accelerate newer technology integration and capabilities into VA Class submarines prior to AN/BLQ-10B upgrades.  These systems are targeted for installation on BLK IV VA Class boats which will not be upgraded to AN/BLQ-10B until mid to late 2020's.  Installation of the EWTT mitigates the BLK IV VA Class' exposure to rapidly changing threats by providing the ability to detect threat signals and other signals of interest.

Name.@footnote: The two additional Virginia Class (VA) SWFTS shipsets procured in FY18 by congressional direction, will be installed in FY19 with funds obtained via below threshold reprogramming.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: TI-16/18 VA/688/21 Class
AIT:: Installation Name: TI-18 SSGN CLASS

Description.val:
Procures Technical Insertions (TI) up through and including TI-18 for installation on LOS ANGELES, SSGN, SEAWOLF, and VIRGINIA Class submarines that provide updates to the AN/BLQ-10A configuration baseline.  The final TI-18 installations will end in FY21.  Beginning with TI-20, all AN/BLQ-10 costs are captured in ML012 due to the significant changes associated with the AN/BLQ-10B upgrade.

TI Processor upgrade provides additional computing capability over previous TI baselines and replaces out of production systems for installation on LOS ANGELES, SSGN, SEAWOLF, and VIRGINIA Class submarines.  Provides updates to the AN/BLQ-10A configuration baseline which incorporates current Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) processing technology and software to account for obsolescence avoidance, and Reliability, Maintainability and Availability (RMA) and associated Integrated Logistics Support (ILS) and technical data. Hardware builds include supporting platform level Submarine Warfare Federated Tactical Systems (SWFTS) interfaces.  Capability and Technical Insertion for AN/BLQ-10A provide spiral improvements to the baseline system which are designed to counter against new and evolving threat emitters.  This effort is the transition of the EW AN/BLQ-10 TI modernization process to eventually synchronize with SWFTS TI/APB process and model.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: TI-20 VA CLASS

Description.val: Procures the AN/BLQ-10B EW system for installation on LOS ANGELES, SEAWOLF, and VIRGINIA Class submarines beginning with TI-20.  AN/BLQ-10B achieves EW superiority through hardware and software updates to pace the threat and brings EW fully onto the SWFTS model.  Tech insertion procures the hardware necessary to upgrade and back-fit EW systems.  This system will be fully aligned with SWFTS with the exception of SSBN Class and provides capabilities required by the EW Capability Development Document (CDD).  The AN/BLQ-10B is a more complex design over the AN/BLQ-10A resulting in a higher unit cost.  NRE costs have been broken out from shipset costs consistent with the other SWFTS subsystems (SSN Acoustic Equipment, SSN Combat Control Systems, and Imaging Systems) who use the SWFTS model.

Name.@footnote: AN/BLQ-10 FCKs are procured in variable quantities and types, and are bought from a variety of vendors each fiscal year.  FY18 decrease of $1M from the PB19 position reflects congressional mark for ANBLQ-10(V) field change kits unit cost growth.

The number of buoys vary from year to year and as a result the quantity reflects the number of controllers with corresponding installs only.  FY20 and FY21 unit costs are perceived to be greater than inflation due to the fluctuation of both controller and buoy quantities included in the total cost.  FY20 reflects a reduction to the PB19 position in order to fund other higher priority requirements.
FY20 reflects a reduction to the PB19 position in order to fund other higher priority requirements.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: Submarine Launch Device (SLD)

Description.val:
Procures AN/BLQ-10 and subsystem Product Improvement Field Change Kits (FCK). One (1) set of AN/BLQ-10 FCKs is procured in each fiscal year that includes variable quantities and types, procured from a variety of vendors.

Procures Submarine Launched Device (SLD) Buoy to reduce risk of counter-detection for operating submarines.  FY20 reflects a reduction to the PB19 position in order to fund other higher priority requirements.

Procures MMM Payload Module antennas to support submarine Fleet required improved Unmanned Aerial System (UAS) communications and Electronic Warfare (EW) capability to meet emerging threats and provide new capabilities required by the Fleet.  FY20 reflects a reduction to the PB19 position in order to fund other higher priority requirements.

ModificationTitle.val: ML018 VA CLASS ES MODERNIZATION PATRIOT

Title.val: ML018 VA CLASS ES MODERNIZATION PATRIOT

Description.val: Procures EW Modernization upgrade of PATRIOT Phase B RADAR range finder for incorporation into the VIRGINIA CLASS Photonics Mast.

Name.@footnote: FY19 reduced due to Congressional Action.
The two additional Virginia Class (VA) SWFTS shipsets procured in FY18 by congressional direction, will be installed in FY19 with funds obtained via below threshold reprogramming.

ImplementationMethodName.val: AIT:: Installation Name: AN/BLQ-10 Backfit Kits

Description.val: Procurement of AN/BLQ-10 NRE and modernization kits for EW Modernization upgrades for all submarine platforms. The rapid proliferation of complex radar, communications and navigation equipment available to potential adversaries creates a need for sustained and significant improvements to submarine systems in order to maintain tactical ship safety and operational effectiveness. Commander Submarine Forces and the Submarine Tactical Requirements Group (STRG) raised EW primary mission area in FY12 to be the number one modernization requirement.  All funding for digital upgrades in ML020 for TI-20 and greater is combined into the ML012 line starting in FY20.
